organization.description1: Wallah We Can is a Tunisian association founded in 2012. The organization strives to guarantee children equitable access to education, a learning-friendly environment, and decent living conditions. It implements sustainable, economical, and ecological solutions that ensure fairer growth and fulfillment for every child.
organization.description2: The association develops projects to guarantee children these five fundamental rights:
organization.quote: Because committing to childhood today means investing in the adults of tomorrow.
organization.title: Wallah We Can (WWC)

why.p1: Wallah We Can is a citizen initiative that, thanks to the support of companies and individuals, develops sustainable projects that directly impact the living and learning conditions of children.
why.p2: Turn your support into concrete action by contributing today to Wallah We Can's projects in Tunisia.
why.p3: Wallah We Can has adopted a code of good conduct that governs the management of donations and ensures transparency towards donors. For more information, contact us.
why.title: Why donate?

Hero.originParagraph: It all began in the dormitories of the Makthar boarding school, where some girls tore foam from their mattresses to protect themselves during their periods. Faced with this invisible injustice—period poverty—Wallah We Can responded: in 2015, we launched a project to produce washable sanitary pads and underwear, designed by and for rural Tunisian women, with the aim of restoring dignity, health and autonomy.
Hero.subtitle: Fighting period poverty in Tunisia and promoting the autonomy of rural women

mission.text: Provide every girl with dignified access to durable, eco-friendly and free sanitary protection, so that none leaves school because of her period.
mission.title: Our mission

vision.text: Make Tunisia the first country to guarantee free access to washable sanitary protection for all school-aged girls.
vision.title: Our vision

Partnership.banner: For every Ecolibree × Chantelle pack sold internationally, a kit of three washable panties is offered to a young Tunisian girl.
Partnership.collab: In collaboration with Chantelle, a world leader in French lingerie
features: Local and committed production: 100% organic cotton, Oeko‑Tex certified
Economic solidarity: job creation for rural women
Accessibility: solidarity pricing (€30 for a 3-pack), free distribution
Durability & comfort: washable, reusable, optimal support
Partnership.heading: The Ecolibree × Chantelle partnership
Partnership.impact: Each Ecolibree × Chantelle pack sold internationally directly contributes to offering sustainable sanitary protection to Tunisian schoolgirls.
Partnership.impactNote: International economic solidarity serving menstrual justice
Partnership.title: Our partnership

Team.description: Our multidisciplinary team combines medical, educational and communication expertise to build a durable and inclusive menstrual justice ecosystem.

Engagements.conclusion1: All these rights are defended within the framework of the Convention on the Rights of the Child (1989), to which Wallah We Can fully adheres.
Engagements.conclusion2: Together, we sow hope. Together, we build a society where every child can grow up protected, educated, free and happy.
Engagements.description: Since 2012, Wallah We Can has been developing entrepreneurial and ecological solutions to address major social issues related to childhood in Tunisia. Through 4 flagship projects, we are committed to guaranteeing 5 fundamental rights to every child.

development.description: We create educational, cultural and sports clubs, led by young graduates from their own region.
development.title: Right to fulfillment

education.description: With e-learning tools and targeted educational support, we help students in vulnerable situations.

equity.description: All these rights are defended with conviction within the framework of the Convention on the Rights of the Child (1989).

health.description: Every child deserves access to a decent standard of living: balanced meals, drinking water, regular medical care, and hygienic protection for girls.
health.title: Right to health

protection.description: We conduct awareness workshops and support child victims with committed professionals.
protection.title: Right to protection

concept.description: The Crescendo concept is based on creating original musical performances, filmed in symbolic places, bringing artists and citizens together around a common cause.

episode1.paragraph: An unprecedented performance on the rooftops of the medina that met with rapid success, raising awareness among a large audience about our cause.
episode1.title: Episode 1
episode1.trackTitle: A.L.A feat ALLCHESTRA - Sur les toits de la médina

episode2.paragraph: A unique collaboration between renowned artists to celebrate hope and rebuilding through music.
episode2.title: Episode 2

hero.description: Crescendo is an engaged musical project led by Wallah We Can to fund actions for children victims of violence and promote culture as a vector of hope.

impact.paragraph: Thanks to Crescendo, we turn the energy of music into concrete actions for children: awareness-raising, funding reception structures and psychological support.
impact.title: Our impact

intro.ambassadeParagraph: The funds raised contribute to financing the Children's Embassy, a dedicated space for welcoming, listening to and supporting children who are victims of violence.
intro.paragraph: Through unique artistic collaborations, Crescendo puts music at the service of a cause: protecting children and funding concrete initiatives.
intro.title: Uniting music and social impact

dior.location: Dar Kamila, residence of the French Ambassador to Tunisia
dior.paragraph1: The Génération Liberté association, which hosted the Wallah We Can initiative in its early years, organized a charity gala at Dar Kamila, the residence of the French Ambassador to Tunisia, with the support of the haute couture house Dior.
dior.paragraph2: This event was organized to raise funds to transform the Makthar boarding middle school. The establishment was in very poor condition, with very few financial resources and pedagogical tools: it offered no comfort to students. Ensuring that every student studies in comfortable conditions while guaranteeing the right to education, health, physical and legal protection, and personal development are the objectives of WWC's actions.
dior.title: Dior Gala 2014

alts.groupPhoto2: Wallah We Can Group Photo - Second view

hero.description: Members of royal and imperial families from Europe and Asia gathered to support child protection in Tunisia.

section1.paragraph1: Every year, Wallah We Can organizes an event that brings together members of the nobility and the international jet set, as well as prestigious brands such as Dior, Dolce & Gabbana and Chopard. WWC aims to make these guests ambassadors of our solutions for children around the world.
section1.title: An Exceptional Event

slimane.paragraph: Winner of The Voice France season 5, Slimane performed a concert in Tunisia in 2016 to support Wallah We Can. The proceeds from the concert helped create several educational clubs within the Makthar boarding middle school.
slimane.subtitle: A Concert for the Cause
slimane.title: Slimane Concert 2016

Diner.title: Dinner of Princes and Princesses for Childhood

wwcInternational.paragraph: In 2021, we celebrated at the Senate, Palais du Luxembourg, the launch of Wallah We Can International: WWC is now present in France, Belgium, England, Germany, Algeria, Luxembourg, Canada, Mexico and the United States.
wwcInternational.title: Wallah We Can International

Media.aboutText: Wallah We Can, founded by Lotfi Hamadi, is a Tunisian association that revolutionizes education and child protection through sustainable, innovative solutions. From the Green School project, a self-sufficient boarding school providing energy and food, to Ecolibree, a program against period poverty, to Wallah We Care for health access and the Children's Embassy defending children's rights, each initiative aims to build a fairer future. These actions, praised by national and international media, put youth at the heart of change.

CallToAction.subtitle: Together, let's transform school into a driver of impact for children, families and communities.

Hero.headline: Make the school a driver of impact
Hero.p1: Since 2012, Wallah We Can has been developing entrepreneurial and ecological solutions to improve children's living and learning conditions.
Hero.p2: With GreenSchool, we implemented an innovative model in a boarding middle school in Makthar (Siliana governorate), based on energy autonomy and food self-sufficiency. The generated benefits are reinvested in school infrastructure and educational activities, while creating jobs for parents—in the fields, kitchens or maintenance—thus strengthening local impact in solidarity.
Hero.title: Green School

presentation.description: Discover the educational vision and details of the GreenSchool program.
presentation.title: Full presentation & educational objectives

Pdf.title: Learn more about the project

Pillars.conclusion: The GreenSchool pillars are designed to address major challenges of the Tunisian education system while creating a model of an autonomous and sustainable school that can be replicated elsewhere.

Hero.approachParagraph: By applying a social and solidarity economy model, Wallah We Can offers a sustainable solution to fight malnutrition in schools by making them self-sufficient in food. We trained unemployed parents in sustainable agriculture, employed them to cultivate 8 hectares of land. The fruits and vegetables grown and harvested are distributed directly to school canteens. The surplus production is then marketed to self-finance the project.
Hero.tagline: A social and solidarity economy model to fight malnutrition in schools

KeyFigures.subtitle: If a child is hungry, teach their parents to farm!
KeyFigures.title: Key figures from the pilot project

Page.description: A social and solidarity economy model combating school malnutrition by making schools food self-sufficient.
Page.title: Kid'chen

hero.title: Wallah We Can Worldwide: With childhood, through education, for a sustainable world!
hero.paragraph: Founded in 2012 in Tunisia and expanded to France since 2018, Wallah We Can Worldwide replicates the GreenSchool model in Lebanon and Palestine to transform educational institutions into self-sufficient social enterprises fostering energy and food independence.

missionVision.missionText: Replicate the GreenSchool model worldwide to address social and environmental challenges via collaborative partnerships. Improve living and learning conditions while aligning with UN SDGs for quality education, clean energy and food security.
missionVision.visionText: Education everywhere, for everyone! A world where every child benefits from a healthy and enriching environment promoting equity and climate resilience.

items.title: Infrastructure rehabilitation
items.text: Renovate for healthy conditions, positively impacting quality of life.

items.text: Photovoltaic panels for sustainable supply lowering costs and boosting resilience.

items.title: Food self-sufficiency
items.text: Sustainable agricultural production for better nutrition and income generation.

france.title: France (since 2018)
france.text: Promotion of inclusive and sustainable education improving environments for thousands of vulnerable children, fostering diversity and equality.

liban.title: Palestine
items: Transformation of 2,500 m² into regenerative agriculture: harvesting 1,000 m³ rainwater/year, planting 8,000 aromatic plants, distillery, 200 hens, waste management.
Impact: Training 80–100 residents, food self-sufficiency, income, environmental awareness.

associations.text: Energy & food autonomy, rehabilitation, programs for better learning & community engagement via municipal partnership.

governance.title: Governance & Transparency
governance.text: Our approach is based on total financial and operational transparency, regular audits and shared governance with local stakeholders to guarantee sustainable impact.

description.paragraph1: A unique beekeeping initiation experience in an authentic natural setting. This package allows teams to discover the fascinating world of bees while strengthening bonds through a collaborative and educational activity.
description.paragraph2: The morning unfolds around the hives with an experienced beekeeper guiding participants through the world of bees, followed by a traditional Berber breakfast in a friendly atmosphere.
description.title: Description

participants.description: 10 to 30 people (minimum of 10 participants per booking)

description.paragraph1: A sensorial immersion into the world of aromatic plants and essential oils. This package invites teams to discover the benefits of aromatherapy while developing creativity and cohesion.
description.paragraph2: The workshop includes harvesting aromatic plants, an introduction to essential oil extraction techniques, and ends with a Berber lunch prepared using freshly picked herbs.

testimonial1.name: Fatima Khelifi
testimonial1.quote: My children love the activities offered by Wallah We Can. It's educational, fun and respectful of the environment. A perfect approach to raise awareness among our little ones about ecology.

testimonial2.name: Ahmed Ben Salah
testimonial2.quote: The artisanal boxes are of exceptional quality. I discovered authentic natural products that perfectly match my eco-responsible values.

testimonial3.name: Leila Trabelsi
testimonial3.quote: The soap making workshop was fantastic! I learned a lot and I highly recommend this experience to anyone interested in natural products.

testimonial4.name: Karim Mansouri
testimonial4.quote: A remarkable initiative that combines artisanal tradition and ecological innovation. The products are authentic and the team is passionate about what they do.

testimonial5.name: Sonia Gharbi
testimonial5.quote: Wallah We Can offers a unique approach to environmental education. My students are always enthusiastic after participating in their workshops.
